content: A language spoken in India, this palindrome is also the name of an Indian film industry.

I think you're referring to "Tamil." Tamil is a Dravidian language primarily spoken in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu and in Sri Lanka, Singapore, and other areas with significant Tamil populations. Additionally, "Tamil" is also the name of the film industry based in Chennai, India, which produces films in the Tamil language. The Tamil film industry is one of the largest in India and has a rich history dating back to the early 20th century. So, Tamil is indeed a palindrome, as it reads the same forwards and backwards, and it's closely associated with both the language and the film industry in India.
